Caption: Sir A.L. Mudaliar escorts Sir C.V. Raman to the dias as the audience stands and watches on with respect
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30th of July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theater. The Chief Guest and speaker, at this historic event for the Institute, was none other than Sir C. V. Raman, the Indian Physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna, for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering. Dr. A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the chairman of the Board of Governors, presided over the ceremony. After being presented a Guard of Honor by the cadets of the N.C.C, Dr. C. V. Raman was received by Dr. A. L. Mudaliar, who introduced him to all the members of the council and senate members who were present at the occasion before proceeding to adorn the academic robes for the ceremony. . A group photo of all the graduates and dignitaries was taken. The dignitaries then proceeded to the convocation venue in a procession of twos.
